answers.answer: NO, do you have a risk? recurrent yeast infection can be brought about by many factors like recent broad spectrum antibiotic, that disrupts the normal flora in the vagina, or using soap as feminine wash and disrupts the acidity of the vagina,..
No, yeast infection in women is not an initial sigh of HIV infection.
even after a 3 month that won't cure itself after possible exposure?
No, not even after 3 months. You didn't have a risk to begin with.

NO, use acidic feminine wash at around ph of 4.5 commercial wash i believe restores the acidity of the vagina... or use 1 part vinegar 3 parts water as wash and ask your provider for antifungal/mycotic preparation oral or vaginal suppository

I gave oral to a guy three times to completion. Approximately 8 days later, I got a yeast infection. For the past three months I have had yeast infections for the past three months. I tested negative for HIV at 31 days. I go tomorrow for my 3 month test. Very worried because people say that yeast infections that are not easily curable are a initial sign of HIV in woman. Thanks!
thanks! I'm still a little worried, but better. I did have risk because I got semen in my mouth and swallowed three times. my doctor says its a low risk but still a risk. thanks!
so have you ever heard of anyone getting HIV this way?

There are some that have claimed to have contracted it that way but none have been varified as that was their only risk. There have been several studies and ongoing studies where neg, pos couples that use condoms for anal and vaginal and not with oral and have never contracted HIV.
Thanks! Hopefully in about a week I will be able to post my negative results!
Recurrent yeast infections can often be the first sign of diabetes.
I've already been tested. Blood sugar was fine thats why I'm concerned about HIV. Ive never had a yeast infection like this before.
Is a negative 31 day test a good sign?

question: Is a recurrent yeast infection in women usually an initial sign of HIV in women? thanks
